pli-tv-kd18:0.4_0: Discussion of the proper conduct for newly arrived monks.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.10_0: “How can the newly arrived monks enter the monastery wearing sandals, holding sunshades, with their heads covered, with their robe on their head; and wash their feet with drinking water, not bow down to the more senior resident monks, and not ask about dwellings?”
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.11_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.12_0: “Is it true, monks, that the newly arrived monks act like this?”
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.15_0: “How can the newly arrived monks act like this? This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.17_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.18_0: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct for newly arrived monks.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.2_0: At that time newly arrived monks entered the monastery wearing sandals, holding sunshades, with their heads covered, with their robes on their heads; and they washed their feet with drinking water, did not bow down to the more senior resident monks, and did not ask about dwellings.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.3_0: A certain newly arrived monk unlocked the bolt of an unoccupied dwelling, opened the door, and entered hastily.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.4_0: A snake fell from the top of the door frame onto his shoulders.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.6_0: Monks came running to and asked him,
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.7_0: and asked why he was screaming.
pli-tv-kd18:1.1.9_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.10_0: which is the water for drinking and which the water for washing.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.11_0: If he needs water to drink, he may take some and drink.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.12_0: If he needs water to wash, he may take some and wash his feet.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.13_0: When he washes his feet, he should pour the water with one hand and wash with the other.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.14_0: He should not pour the water and wash his feet with the same hand.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.15_0: He should ask for a sandal-wiping cloth, and then wipe them.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.16_0: first with a dry cloth and then a wet one.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.17_0: He should wash a sandal-wiping cloth, and then wipe them.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.18_0: If a resident monk is more senior, the newly arrived monk should bow down to him.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.19_0: If a resident monk is more junior, he should bow down to the newly arrived monk.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.1_0: When a newly arrived monk enters a monastery, he should remove his sandals, hold them low, knock them together, and carry them along; he should lower his sunshade, uncover his head, and put his robe over his shoulders; he should then enter the monastery carefully and without hurry.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.20_0: The newly arrived monk should ask which dwelling he may use
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.21_0: and whether it’s occupied or not. He should ask about where to go for alms and where to avoid, about any families designated as “in training”, about the place for defecating and the place for urinating, about the water for drinking and the water for washing, about walking sticks, and about the Sangha’s agreements
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.22_0: concerning the right time to enter and the right time to depart.
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.3_0: he should look out for where the resident monks gather—
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.5_0: whether it’s in the assembly hall, under a roof-cover, or at the foot of a tree—
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.7_0: He should then put his bowl and robe aside,
pli-tv-kd18:1.2.8_0: and sit down on a suitable seat.
pli-tv-kd18:1.3.10_0: He should take out the leaning board and put them aside.

pli-tv-kd18:1.3.2_0: If the dwelling is dirty, and if beds or benches are stacked on top of one another with furniture in a pile on top, he should clean it if he is able.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.10_0: If it is hot, he should close the windows on the following day, open by night or by day.

pli-tv-kd18:1.5.14_0: If the fire is dirty, he should sweep it.

pli-tv-kd18:10.1.1_0: At that time the monks used the restroom according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.2_0: Junior monks who had arrived before others had to wait to defecate.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.3_0: Holding it in, they fainted and collapsed.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.4_0: They told the Buddha. He then had the Sangha gathered and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.7_0: “The restroom should not be used according to seniority.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.8_0: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:10.1.9_0: You should use the restroom according to the order of arrival.”
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six entered the restroom too hastily, pulled up their robe before entering, groaned while defecating, brushed their teeth while defecating, defecated outside the toilet, urinated outside the urinal, spat in the urinal, used coarse wiping sticks, threw the wiping sticks in the cesspit, left the restroom too hastily, came out with their robe still pulled up, made a chomping sound while rinsing, and they left water in the scoop for rinsing.
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.2_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.3_0: “How can the monks from the group of six act like this?”
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.4_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.8_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:10.2.9_0: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to restrooms.

pli-tv-kd18:11.14.1_0: “If the preceptor becomes discontent, the student should send him away or have him sent away, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.2_0: If the preceptor becomes anxious, the student should dispel it, or he should give him a teaching.
pli-tv-kd18:11.14.3_0: If the preceptor has a wrong view, the student should make him give it up or have someone else do it, or he should give him a teaching.

pli-tv-kd18:11.3.2_0: If the preceptor wants an attendant, the student should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. After washing his bowl, he should take it with him and be his preceptor’s attendant.

pli-tv-kd18:2.1.0_0: Discussion of the proper conduct for resident monks
pli-tv-kd18:2.1.1_0: At that time, when they saw newly arrived monks, the resident monks did not prepare seats, or put out foot-stools, foot-scrapers, or water for washing the feet. They did not go out to meet them to receive their bowls and robes, or ask if they wanted water to drink. They did not bow down to more senior newly arrived monks or assign dwellings to them.

pli-tv-kd18:6.2.23_0: want to give to a slave or a servant.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.24_0: If they make physical contact with something, they tell him to wait,
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.26_0: When they have given alms, he should cover the bowl with his upper robe, and depart carefully and without hurry.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.27_0: One should be well-covered while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.28_0: One should not squat on one’s heels while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.2_0: When he is about to enter the village,
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.3_0: he should remove his sandals, hold them low and knock them together, before putting them in a bag, which he should hang from his shoulder. He should put on his sarong evenly all around, covering the navel and the knees. He should put on a belt. Putting the upper robes together, overlapping each other edge-to-edge, he should put them on and fasten the toggle. After washing his bowl, he should take it with him and enter the village carefully and without hurry.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.4_0: One should be well-covered while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.5_0: One should not walk in an inhabited area with arms akimbo.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.6_0: One should not cover one’s head while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-kd18:6.2.7_0: One should not squat on one’s heels while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.1_0: When he has left the village, he should put his bowl in its bag and hang it from his shoulder, fold up his robe and put it on his head, and put on his sandals and go.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.2_0: A monk who is staying in the wilderness should set out water for drinking and water for washing; he should light a fire and provide upper and lower fire sticks; he should provide a walking stick; and he should learn the constellations—
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.3_0: all of them or those in one direction—and become skilled in the cardinal directions.
pli-tv-kd18:6.3.4_0: This is the proper conduct for those staying in the wilderness.”
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.0_0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.11_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.12_0: “Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.1_0: On one occasion when a number of monks were making robes outside,
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.2_0: the monks from the group of six were beating furniture in an open space upwind from them.
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.5_0: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.7_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
pli-tv-kd18:7.1.8_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.10_0: After taking note of where it’s placed, he should take out the floor-cover and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.11_0: If the dwelling has cobwebs, he should first remove them from the ceiling cloth, and he should then wipe the windows and the corners of the room.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.12_0: If the wall is black, he should pour the wall, and he should shoes them in a corners. He should then strew it and swallowed it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.13_0: If the black color of black colored on the skull, he should remove them from his ears, and then wipe them off.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.14_0: If there is no ground, he should sweep it away.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.1_0: If the dwelling he is staying in is dirty, a monk should clean it if he is able.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.21_0: He should not beat the furniture in an open area upwind from these things,
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.2_0: When he is cleaning the dwelling, he should first take out the bowl and robe and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.3_0: He should take out the sitting mat and the sheet and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.4_0: He should take out the mattress and the pillow and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.5_0: Holding the bed low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.6_0: Holding the bench low, he should carefully take it out without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.7_0: He should take out the bed supports and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.8_0: He should take out the spittoon and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.2.9_0: He should take out the leaning board and put them aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.10_0: When putting away the bowl, he should hold the bowl in one hand, feel under the bed or the bench with the other, and then put it on the other, and put it aside.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.11_0: He should not put his bowl on the bare ground.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.12_0: When he puts his robe, one hand in the bamboo robe-rack, or the clothesline with the other, and then puts it on the other upper robe, and put it on the other side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.1_0: He should sun the floor-cover, clean it, beat it, bring it back inside, and put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.2_0: He should sun the bed supports, wipe them, bring them back inside, and place them in the same position as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.3_0: He should sun the bed, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.4_0: He should sun the bench, clean it, and beat it. Holding it low, he should carefully bring it back inside without scratching it or knocking it against the door or the door frame, and he should put it back in the same place as before.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.5_0: He should sun the mattress and the pillow, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.6_0: He should sun the sitting mat and the sheet, clean them, beat them, bring them back inside, and put them back the way they were.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.7_0: He should sun the spittoon, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.8_0: He should sun the leaning board, wipe it, bring it back inside, and put it back where it was.
pli-tv-kd18:7.3.9_0: he should keep the bowl and robe for a bowl.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.10_0: If the fire is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.11_0: If the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.12_0: If he doesn’t drink, he should set out water for drinking and water for washing.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.13_0: If there is no water for drinking or water for washing, he should set out.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.14_0: If there is no water in the pot for rinsing water, he should fill it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.15_0: If he is staying in the same dwelling as a more senior monk, he should not do any of the following without asking him for permission: recite, question, rehearse, teach, turn a lamp on or off, or open or close a window.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.16_0: If he is walking up and down on a walking-path together with a more senior monk, he should walk behind him, but he should not hit him with the corners of his robe.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.17_0: This is the proper conduct in regard to dwellings.”
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.1_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the east, the west, the north, and the southern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.2_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the west, he should close the west,
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.3_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the north, he should close the windows on the northern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.4_0: If dusty winds are blowing from the south, he should close the windows on the southern side.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.5_0: If it’s the wrong time, he should open the wind by day or by night on the day.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.6_0: If it is hot, he should close the windows on the following day, open by night or by day.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.7_0: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.8_0: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:7.4.9_0: If the assembly hall is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.0_0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to saunas.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.11_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.12_0: “If you’re kept out of a sauna by senior monks, you should not, out of disrespect, stack up much firewood and light it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.13_0: If he does, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.14_0: And you should not close the door and sit down against it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.15_0: If you do, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.1_0: At that time the monks from the group of six did not lay down the sauna on the senior monks. They then entered the sauna, put it on fire, and close to the door. Then they sat down on the door, and lay down on the door.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.2_0: The monks overheated, but being unable to open the door, they fainted and collapsed.
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.4_0: “How can the monks from the group of six do this?”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.5_0: The monks overheated, but being unable to open the door, they fainted and collapsed.”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.6_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that the monks from the group of six did this?”
pli-tv-kd18:8.1.8_0: The monks overheated, but being unable to open the door, they fainted and collapsed.”
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.10_0: He should not sit encroaching on the senior monks
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.11_0: or blocking the junior monks from seats.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.12_0: If he is able, he should do services for the senior monks in the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.13_0: He then left the sauna and knockledge, before leaving.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.14_0: If he is able, he should also do services for the senior monks in the water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.15_0: He should not bathe in front of the senior monks or upstream from them.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.16_0: When he is coming out of the water after bathing, he should give way to those who are entering the water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.17_0: If the sauna is muddy, the last monk to leave it should wash it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.18_0: He should wash the clay trough, put away the sauna stool, extinguish the fire, close the door, and then depart.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.19_0: This is the proper conduct in regard to saunas.”
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.1_0: Well then, I will lay down the proper conduct in regard to saunas.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.2_0: The monk who goes first to the sauna should discard the ashes if they are building up.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.3_0: If the sauna is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.4_0: If the area immediately outside the restroom is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.5_0: If the precincts are dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.6_0: If the gateway is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.7_0: If the sauna shed is dirty, he should sweep it.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.8_0: He should knead bath powder, moisten the clay, and fill the water trough with water.
pli-tv-kd18:8.2.9_0: He should cover the sauna with clayakkhali and entered the sauna.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.0_0: Discussion of the proper conduct in regard to restroom.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.10_0: “Is it true, monk, that you don’t rinse after defecating?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.13_0: and after giving a teaching he addressed the monks:
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.14_0: “When there is water available, you should rinse after defecating.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.15_0: If you don’t, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.1_0: At that time a monk who had been born as a brahmin did not want to rinse after defecating, thinking,
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.2_0: “Who would touch this foul, stinking stuff?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.3_0: As a result, a worm settled in his anus.
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Devadatta,
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.8_0: “How can a monk not rinse after defecating?”
pli-tv-kd18:9.1.9_0: They then told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Devadatta:
